\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(Why did I get in here?! I need to go the other side.)
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I'm sitting here for two days now waiting for someone
to play dice with me. No chow, no sleep . . . And
I stink like a swine already.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>You will play "zonk" with me, right?! Will you!?
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(I think it's important to him. Should I say yes?) \!
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>I don't mind. . . but I don't know how.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>It's okay, it's okay, I'll teach you. It's an
\TA[1]You and I roll the dice one by one. On your turn, you can
set aside any combination of dice or several combinations
\TA[1]After you select the dice that will bring you points, you
can roll the remaining ones and try to earn
more (\i[14]), or you can end your turn (\i[15]).
In the first case, you can lose turn points if there are no
combinations among latest roll, and in the second case,
turn points is summed to the total score. Total score
There is another feature: if during your turn you select all six
dice, you can roll all the dice and continue to score points until
you lose them or end your turn.
\c[6]The winner is the player who reach 4000 points.\
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Good, good. Well, let's play, how many groshes are
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Of course. They usually play "zonk" for money. So,
how many coins are you ready to bet? Humph???
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>If it is about money, I have only \V[0001] rupy.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I see, rupy. . . Humph. . . Never heard of those,
and I guess you've never heard of groshes.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Then there's no point in playing for money. Will
have to play for something else.
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>Why don't we just play, without betting?
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>We can't! We can't play without stakes! It's a gamble,
and we can't gamble without actually gambling!!
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Wait, now, now I'll think of something we could
bet. . . Well. . . well, well, well, well, well. . .
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Here, I got it: if you win, you'll get an elegant
dice that brings you luck not only in game, but
in life and even with love.
Inzhir took a dice out of his pocket.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>No other dice like this exists.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>This dice is unique: elegant handicraft, redwood
plummy oil paint and golden shill lacquer all the
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Just take a look at this piece of art.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Of course, of course, and you have a chance to own
this magnificent dice if you beat me at the game.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>And then the world will be at your feet, all doors
opened and all roads in stone. The Fortune herself
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Well, and if you lose, I won't take much from
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Just you sweet body for a couple of hours. No match
for such a treasure that is almost in your pocket.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Well, let us begin, roll the dice.
Rodinka smiled, nodded and rolled the dice. . .
on a hunch without second thought.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I lost, lost. . . How can it be?!
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(My first game and I won right away!)
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I admit, you play well. Here is you reward.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Hold it dear, it will bring you luck, and I. . . I. . .
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>. . . I need to sleep. . .
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(It seems he fell asleep. I won't disturb him.)
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(I lost, but it was still fun.)
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Time to give victor what is accrued to him.
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>Erm, what was the bet from my side? I have misheard
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I'm telling: your huge tits!
Inzhir lost his consciousness. His body fell on
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>Oh, what's wrong with you? Are you alright?
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>No, I'm sorry, I can't. I don't even know how to play.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>"Don't know", is that really a problem?! I will teach
you, don't worry, the game is really simple.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Well, are you ready to listen?!
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>No, no, no. Sorry, but I can't play with you, I need
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Please, please, please, I haven't played "zonk" for
so long, my whole body aches.
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>I can think only about dice. . . Flying dice, lying
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Aagh!! I can't hold! I need to play!
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Let's play. Come on, please!
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>If you agree, I'll give you this unique dice.
Inzhir took a dice out of his pocket and showed
\nc<\c[3]Inzhir from Skatitsa\>Just play with me. Right now, come on!
Inzhir lost his consciousness and fell on the ground.
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>Ou, what's wrong with you? Are you alright?
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(Seems like he just fell asleep. Nothing to worry
\nc<\c[2]Rodinka\>(I won't go naked in front of him.)
